Title.En: Track birds, empower informed biodiversity decisions

Description.En:
Wind Town (www.vejomiestelis.lt) is a visionary project developed by SBA Urban, part of one of the largest Lithuanian business groups, SBA. Since 2007, SBA Urban has delivered over 226,000 sq. m. of exceptional spaces, including internationally recognized projects such as Unity Square and the BLC business center in Kaunas, the iconic Nemunaičiai district, and the Green Hall business hub in Vilnius.

With a passion for architectural aesthetics and sustainability, SBA Urban collaborates with global architecture leaders to create innovative buildings that transform cities, enhance communities, and set new standards for design.

SBA Urban ultimate goal is to enhance understanding of local biodiversity by developing advanced tools to identify and monitor bird species around Wind Town. These solutions will empower communities to make informed decisions that protect wildlife and contribute to the long-term preservation of fragile ecosystems.

This challenge is an opportunity to combine cutting-edge technology with nature-focused initiatives. Whether through digital tools, data-driven systems, or interactive applications, we aim to create solutions that are practical, engaging, and impactful.

Your solutions will not only help monitor bird life but also inspire communities to better understand, appreciate, and protect the natural world around them. By taking part, you’re shaping the future of sustainable development and biodiversity conservation.

PrefLabel.En: evaluate data, information and digital content

NoteLiteral.En: Self-sufficiently pinpoint a unique and impactful research direction, utilizing existing knowledge and acquired competencies.
Innovatively tackle complex real-world issues using the core tenets of challenge-based learning methodology.
Utilise effective teamwork and leadership principles while collaborating within diverse, interdisciplinary teams.

Title.En: Create and present ideas and prototypes

NoteLiteral.En: Create and effectively present innovative ideas and developed prototypes tailored to the requirements of unique audience.

Title.En: Track birds, empower informed biodiversity decisions
Track birds, empower informed biodiversity decisions

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
[Syllabus](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=INNOM010&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)of the micro module.

The challenge will be solved in the module „**Development of Challenge-Based Innovation**“ (6 ECTS, online meetings – 32 hours, individual and group work – 128 hours). The module follows the challenge-based learning method: engagement, inspiration, investigation, and action.

The challenge will be delivered in the KTU virtual learning environment. When a student is enrolled in KTU, s/he will be informed by email on how to gain access to the challenge.

The challenge will take place **from March 6 to May 29, 2025**. The scheduled meetings with the teamchers and the peer learners will be held **once a week on Thursdays:** March 6, 13, 20, 27; April 10, 17, 24; May 8, 22, 29. The meetings will be held **at 15.30-17.00/18.30 EET**(depending on the day). Please note that attendance is mandatory and highly appreciated by your team members.

The learners are supported by the KTU teamchers (faculty) and the partner company Urban Wind. The learner teams are presented with the challenge during the kick-off meeting, they are invited to do an interim presentation on the progress of their project in the middle of the module and the final presentation of the challenge solution at the last meeting of the module. The final grade is passed/failed.

After the successful completion of the challenge:

- In two weeks, a student will receive an email with the link to download the ECIU University micro-credential.
- In mid-June 2025, a student from other university than KTU will receive an email with the KTU Transcript of Records that might be presented for recognition of learning outcomes at the home university.
How can we empower communities to make better choices that protect wildlife?

Every year, countless bird species remain unrecorded, limiting our ability to understand and protect their fragile ecosystems. This challenge invites You to create cutting-edge solutions that identify and track the diverse birds life thriving around the „WindTown“ bird watch tower — an initiative that can help to empower community to make better choices protecting wildlife. 

Challenge provider - company "SBA Urban" is developing unique "Wind Town" in collaboration with the award-winning "Gensler" architectural team, known for creating iconic projects worldwide. Located in the serene environment of Svencelė, the project harmonizes active and tranquil lifestyles with the majority of the area dedicated to green and recreational spaces. 

By participating, You will contribute to creating tools that promote environmental awareness, citizen science, and sustainable habitat management. Your work will not only sharpen your skills but also play a meaningful role in preserving biodiversity and fostering resilient, resource-efficient communities.
